website_summaries.verdict: A heavy-duty workhorse that's perfect for a variety of uses, including blocking excess noise at loud job sites.
pros: Include AM/FM radio with digital tuner
Hearing protector limits decibels with a noise-reduction rating of 24 decibels
Voice Assist adds a variety of functions and makes programming easier
cons: Poor sound quality while doing loud activities like mowing
Complicated instructions that have to be read to utilize headphones

customer_reviews.title: This hearing protector is a great design and plays good sound with many options and ...
customer_reviews.text: This hearing protector is a great design and plays good sound with many options and has a one (1) year warranty. After the one (1) year I lost audio in the speaker opposite the control side. I only wore it mowing grass maybe a total of thirty (30) times in 2017. I called 3M and they say the warranty is out ( I already knew that), they will not replace it and there is no repair. BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney !.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected! They cancel outside noise and bring in radio stations clearly. My wife uses them when riding the lawn tractor, and operating the log splitter. Indoors she uses them when she vacuums to cancel noise, but because they are comfortable to wear she often wars them around the house now...just to listen to music. They're almost too good, because I have to hit her with a pillow to get her attention! You neeed these!
customer_reviews.author: AL NOLF

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Great AM/FM Hearing Protection Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I was immediately impressed with the quality materials, silky smooth knobs, the great comfort and fit, the wonderful reception, the precision digital tuning (each click on the knob is a 10 kHz AM or 0.1 MHz FM frequency change), and the helpful voice assist. I was able to quickly set up my favorite presets with assistance from the well-written, and helpful instructions. The sound quality was very good, with three levels of bass (off, boost 1, and boost 2) to customize my sound. The auto off (to save batteries) was a nice bonus. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Already not working
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in March 2018. Used when mowing the lawn a few times this spring. The last few times I've tried to use them, there's no sound, either from the radio or from an attached mp3 player. I've replaced the batteries. Today, I went out and bought new batteries, thinking the batteries I had been using were possibly getting old. Nope. Nothing. BTW, when it WAS working, it really chewed through batteries. Even though I was meticulous about turning the headphones off after using, the batteries would only last about a week - just long enough to be dead when I was ready to mow again.
customer_reviews.author: NatureMaid

customer_reviews.title: Better tuner than older model had - -
customer_reviews.text: I just got these and wore them while mowing this week. I had a pair that was 13 years old and they were slowly degrading. Lots of hours in the hot NC sun. I like the new features like memory recall for favorite stations. Bass boost is pretty good too. But what really sets these apart from the old ones is their ability to lock in a station. My favorite rock station was constantly getting walked on by another station with the old unit. A problem that always existed. This new set locks it in, and it doesn't fade. Sooo much better! I highly recommend this work tunes headset. RS
customer_reviews.author: R&DinNC

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: These head phone (muffs) do the job for mowing the lawn (acre plus). I do find they can be a little warm when the sun is high and the heat is on, but a little sweet beats hearing damage. It would be nice to find some wicking type material for the ear muff seal instead of the soft vinyl but that is the only draw back i found. The FM radio holds stations which is rare in my location due to the terrain. Overall i would recommend them for those who would like to jam while cutting their lawn and protecting their hearing at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 days (3 hours total)
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 2 days and then the dial wouldn't get but one station, slipped or IDK :( Am returning.
customer_reviews.author: LQ

customer_reviews.title: Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: The headphones work great! Once allowing the station scan (per the directions) the radio stations in the area all come in great and can be heard easily! Haven't had any trouble with Bluetooth either easy to hear and maintains connection.
customer_reviews.author: AJTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Works well when mowing and leaf blowing
customer_reviews.text: We had similar radio headphones made by Stanley but after the second pair crapped out, I decided to move on. We're trying these by 3M. They are very similar to the Stanley. They block the mower/blower noise and you can hear the music just fine. One thing they have that Stanley didn't was a voice that announces what station you're on as you are searching for stations. That's super nice! I hope these last longer than the Stanley's. I really like them so far!
customer_reviews.author: Solobiz

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Radio works fairly well. Audio jack works very well. Great at reducing outside noise levels. Can be worn with safety glasses and still function reasonably well. Will make your ears area sweat a bit of worn on hot days or while doing heavy exertion. I used these while doing manual labor, they stay securely on. Work reasonably well as ear muffs on colder days. I listened to audio books and music while operating commercial grade machines, so they definitely do the job. Dropped them more than once, they hold up quite well. The auto tune function on the radio is nice and switching between save stations is easy enough to do one handed while wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Funny

customer_reviews.title: Looks fine....but it hurts & doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately.....this is the very 1st product I ever bought on Amazon that merited a bad review. First of all....they hurt. The headpiece is so darn tight, both my ears are killing me when I wear them. Secondly....the reception for the FM is terrible. I bought these intentionally for FM radio usage ( as I already have headphones for yardwork). The reception is VERY checkered outside....and inside /in my basement while working on projects....forget it. I regret making this purchase...sorry. Peter
customer_reviews.author: peter cullinan

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this brand of headphones for years. This is my third pair. My second pair had Bluetooth which my first set didn't and I saw much less battery life with this set. So, I bought this set without the Bluetooth hoping that the batteries would last longer. But they don't as I'm still only getting four hours to a set of eneloop batteries. On these I do like the volume switch / on/off switch better than the second pair that I had. But the station selection knob is still very easy to bump and go off station. In the long run I would go back to a pair with Bluetooth to syn. to my phone again.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Gifted successfully
customer_reviews.text: Gift for nephew. But, I have a pair of my own, and they're good for both lawnmower noise reduction and boredom reduction. The FM reception is good, and the AM reception fair. The tuning system takes some getting used to; the designer should maybe make it possible to know if you're tuning up or down by touch, since you can't see when you're wearing the phones. But, they work, they're not costly, and they come in a nice yellow and black motif. There's a pricier alternative with a display panel for tuning, but again, if you're wearing the phones, you can't see the panel anyway. Buy these, they'll work fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: D. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Poorly thought-out controls
customer_reviews.text: Audio quality and reception is fine, but controls are horrible. If you bump that huge, unprotected tuning knob, which anyone who works in these will do frequently, you'll have to go through the tedious job of resetting the channel - and changing the channel via audio feedback is extremely tedious. I glued a shield around the tuning knob to protect it and that has corrected that issue. The volume control is located so that turning your head can cause the volume control to contact your shoulder and change the volume. It is the next control I will probably have to shield. All in all these things work, but they could be a lot more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Toolie

customer_reviews.title: Design not the best.
customer_reviews.text: For my use, the setup / ergonomics has been a challenge. I mow around a lot of trees. Sometimes the branches will change the channel since the button is round. Then it is hard to return it back to where you were. The branches also push the frequency button, which changes the station. Sometimes I like the fact that the station id is told to you but most of the time I don't like the voice talking. I also wish I had more control over the volume, not that I would use it much higher but there are times I want to jam with the song and I feel like I should be able to do that.
customer_reviews.author: SMG

customer_reviews.title: As good as the high reviews said it would be.
customer_reviews.text: This stores up to 25 AM stations & up to 25 PM stations. Instructions with it for how to store stations & switch stations, are very clearly written. Switching stations takes a minute to get accustomed to because there is no tuning dial, but after a minute getting accustomed to how to add stations & switch stations, that works amazingly well A great thing about this is once you program stations in it, you never have to look at any knob or switch to use this, As of now (May 2020) I can receive all am & fm radio stations on this.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't hear radio with mower running
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable, but in the year or so that I have owned them, the maximun volume has decreased to the point that they are useless if I am running anything motorized....which is, of course, why one wears ear protection in the first place!!!
customer_reviews.author: James Mctamaney

customer_reviews.title: Save your ears, listen to some tunes!
customer_reviews.text: Great hearing protection. Used primarily for mowing. If you got alot to mow you may get a little bored and need some entertainment. These are a cost effective way to protect your ears and listen to the radio. Almost got the bluetooth model but didnt want to carry my phone with me while mowing. Definitely saves my ears while listening to some tunes!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great Hearing Protection
customer_reviews.text: This 3M WorkTunes AM/FM Hearing Protector is a replacement for the same identical unit that I have had for over three years and I broke by accident. I use it mostly for working outside around the yard when using my yard power equipment. Even when mowing the lawn on my lawn tractor the music comes through clearly and with enough volume to hear comfortably.. As I have had such excellent experience with a previous 3M WorkTunes Hearing Protector the decision to purchase another was a no brainer from my perspective. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Barry R.

customer_reviews.title: Average performance
customer_reviews.text: Average performance. They are fairly comfortable, they will muffle the noise of the mower, and you can hear some music. However, for some reason, the older model I purchased several years ago performed better. With this model the radio signal does not want to come in 'stereo' sometimes. My biggest complaint would be the volume does not go as high as the previous model, and is not as loud as I would like. When you ride a loud lawn tractor and you want to crank up the volume on a good song, you cant turn these up as loud as you would like.
customer_reviews.author: BB1032

customer_reviews.title: Required batteries make this a terrible choice for people looking to use with a phone/mp3.
customer_reviews.text: You think these could function like normal headphones when connected to an MP3 player/Phone, but instead you must use batteries. I end up changing batteries every couple days, and even then it's a huge pain to get the headphones to even function correctly (have to plug it in and out multiple times to get sound to come out, turn the power/sound knob multiple times). My iPhone detects it fine, and all other pairs of headphones work great on it- just this terrible product gives it trouble.
customer_reviews.author: aljovido

customer_reviews.title: They work, mostly
customer_reviews.text: Some of the equipment I work with is very noisy and maybe this isn't exactly the product I need, but they are the kind of uses these are likely to be tasked with by normal, everyday users. I think many people who use these are also going to be wearing hats and glasses, like I do, and both of those can interfere with the seal needed for these to work well. My rototiller and my zero turn are both so loud that I can't really use the radio part of the unit, and sometimes I even double-up by wearing in-ear hearing protection in conjunction with these. I may keep looking for better.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Car Racing
customer_reviews.text: I use these for car racing. the local track plays the radio commentary so i wanted to hear that over the cars. wearing them for 12hrs straight (endurance races lol) they get a little uncomfortable but i know thats extreme. short periods of time they feel great and arent too hot. Noise level is about what you get from standard ear plugs. the radio volume is mostly OK though sometimes i wished it would be a little louder. but loud radio isnt much better for you than race car noises! lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That it stops working in two years.
customer_reviews.text: This was great when it worked. I used it during the night to listen to music when I couldn't sleep. But it's just two years and it only has 3 stations now. I didn't keep my receipt so I am out of luck. Products should last more than two years, for that kind of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Improved reception but too tight
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement over the older version I purchased a few years ago from Walmart. Reception is better, and tuning an FM station is easier with the new addition of voice assist. The volume control sometimes brushes my shoulder, lowering the sound, but my biggest complaint is how the very tight fit hurts after an hour or so; also hard to wear sunglasses as another reviewer mentioned. My hat size is large, so possibly someone who wears a small hat size would be OK with the tight fit. This one has no BlueTooth option.
customer_reviews.author: E. Paul Austin

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but heavy
customer_reviews.text: This unit provides good noise cancellation and radio quality. The only problem is that it is a bit heavy and my head gets hot when I wear it on long walks. The channel selection is an unusual method as a voice tells you what channel you are on as you cycle through the channels. It was easy to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Reasor

customer_reviews.title: Middle of the road
customer_reviews.text: I live 15 miles from a 50,000 watt AM radio station and have trouble picking up a clear signal, plus the volume doesn't seem to go high enough. Don't bother trying to use the "preset" settings, kind of a hassle. Granted I only wear them while using a riding lawn mower, but I still expected a little better product. -1 Star... Poor reception -1 Star... Low volume / poor noise canceling They still do the job, I'll keep them.... besides, not gonna try and return something that's covered in ear sweat
customer_reviews.author: mp6003

customer_reviews.title: fit well and radio sounds good.
customer_reviews.text: the radio tuner is fairly easy to set up and use. station sensitivity is pretty good. the volume knob kind of sticks out front and tends to get knocked off some, but not too bad. the tuner knob in the middle can get knocked off station also if you are working in some tight quarters. Overall, these are minor issues that mostly get worked out as you use them and get used to having the knobs there.
customer_reviews.author: S Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good tunes
customer_reviews.text: I'm an Operating Engineer and use hearing protection all the time. These not only protect your hearing, but also allow you to listen to your favorite tunes. The level of comfort is top notch. These are about the 6th pair that I've bought over many years of work. These do take a lot of abuse and last. You definitely get what you pay for, high quality. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to protect my ears while mowing and also it's nice to listen to music.. they fit good but not too snug, the cancel out the noise well and even with the music on its loud enough to hear that and be aware of your surroundings as well. The radio picks up well and will shut off automatically after a few hours. Can program stations and it's easy to use. Only wish I would have purchased sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Amber R

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with shipping and missing cord.
customer_reviews.text: At the moment I am not impressed with this product. Although I chose to buy a good used product the description assured it would be in the original packaging. The instructions, and headphones were loosely tossed in the box. I gave this product one star due to not being able to use it yet because there is no audio cord to attach it to my iPhone. When I can actually use the product I may choose to change the rating. Very disappointed at this time. Thanks for reading!
customer_reviews.author: No name

customer_reviews.title: Volume doesn't go loud enough
customer_reviews.text: The headphones do what they are described to do. I can pick up several stations on my rural farm and standing outside, they seem to be the ticket. The problem is, when you get on the riding mower you can't turn up the radio enough to hear it over the mower. If the volume could be turned up, I would give them a 5 star rating but since it won't they're worthless to me....
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: This is a good price and works well for me.
customer_reviews.text: The radio tunes in well and sounds good. If there is a lot of outside noise, the radio must be turned up to near max. But the batteries last a very long time. It is very rugged and seems to block sound more than similar hearing protection i have. As for comfort: when i got it is was too tight and it was hard to adjust. Also, like any ear protection, it gets hot after a while. I would say it is more hot than other ear protectors i have. But it is still worth it to have the radio. Sometimes i wear it just for the radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, comfortable protection for your hearing
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice headphones. Purchased for when using the lawn mower and can still hear the mower but noise is greatly reduced and radio (FM) comes in really well. Tried to wear a visor or hat with these but then they didn’t fit around the ears as well, so heard more mower noise. They are comfortable but don’t expect to have a great hairdo after (more for women) as they fit pretty snug and flatten hair. Worth it, however, to protect hearing - should have been wearing years ago!
customer_reviews.author: nelson9

customer_reviews.title: Took a little getting used to because it has no digital readout, but now my husband likes it
customer_reviews.text: At first my husband thought he would never be able to use this product because it does not have a digital readout of the radio channels. It took some doing, but we finally figured out that the information is all auditory and a voice walks you through the channel selection. Once we figured that out he has been happy with it. He uses it at college football games as he prefers to get the more involved radio play-by-play rather than the briefer live loud-speaker announcements. It also told him recently that his battery life was low -- a very good feature.
customer_reviews.author: N. Davis

customer_reviews.title: High quality, great radio too!
customer_reviews.text: Well built, easy access to controls, good sound stopping quality, I like that a women's voice tells me what I have selected, even what radio frequency I am on. I have tuned to and saved many radio stations. Sounds very good. Adj bass levels. Minor dislikes..it is a bit heavy, it's tight on the head and I had trouble understanding what the women said..Push mode to cycle through options..I have some hearing loss..maybe it's me. They are very good. It's a BUY!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: In Northern Idaho I am able to pick up 9 stations from the surrounding areas with minor static on a few of these stations. The music level is not that loud, but sufficient. The sound is good. The unit blocks out sound well. I like the option of having the radio search for all available stations it can find, this is a really nice feature. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Bern

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really like these!! love the idea that they are Bluetooth and protect your ears at the same time. I don't use them much on Bluetooth just the radio setting and it works Great!! I run a saw all day and my ear buds/ear plugs start hurting my ears after a couple of hours. I will buy these again!! They are easy on the ears and head. GREAT PRODUCT AND GOOD COMPANY TO ORDER FROM!! Easy to clean when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Vicker H

customer_reviews.title: Turn it UP
customer_reviews.text: Can barely hear music even on full. The regulations put on sound out put, so a person does not damage hearing is ridiculous. Im an adult, if I want to listen to loud tunes...that for (me) to choose. But THIS is over the top. When not on mower and Im in a silent room, the radio isnt very loud even.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Owner 3

customer_reviews.title: Great hearing protection. These are a great bargain!
customer_reviews.text: My Significant Other is a heavy equipment operator and operates bull dozers and huge excavation equipment. These are wonderful to protect his hearing and still provide a radio for his favorite oldies channel. He said he would like to be able to turn the volume up higher, but there is a limit to volume to protect the user from hearing damage from that aspect. He understands that it's for his protection and said it's the best present I have given him. He loves these!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaye Perry

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeling yet not enough volume to hear radio
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a prior set that I wore out over time. Noise canceling is great and comfortable but unfortunately the volume for listening to the radio is poor . I drive a 50 hp tractor and cant hear the radio with volume full up so basically its now just a noise control headset. Ill have to buy another brand so I can listen to the radio
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: They work well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to primarily use while mowing the lawn. However, I have enjoyed them for other occasions. The sound is quite good, good reception, decent quality. The volume is not overwhelming but I can easily hear the radio while using my riding mower. I have noticed that it can pick up some interference but not enough to discourage the use. The muffs are quite large, reaching out nearly three inches from the ear. Like any muff ear-protectors...they can get mighty hot on the ears. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Russell C.

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite lawn mowing hearing protection
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. I had my doubts about controlling the radio. I was pleasantly surprised. They sound great. I haven't used them with my MP3 player yet. Just the radio. They fit well. I highly recommend them. I was considering a bluetooth set, but... These take a pair of AA batteries. I don't like taking the iPhone on the mower. Hearing is protected, and one of my favorite stations comes in. The only trouble I had was getting the batteries in... They were awfully snug to snap in. Like shockingly difficult to get the batteries in. I did not take a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: not as good as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar headset that I had used for 8-10 years. This radio is not as easy to operate as that one was. The volume is not as high for the radio as the other one was. I use this when cutting grass or working outside. It is ok with equipment is not running but if the mower or other equipment is running, I cannot hear the music from the radio. Also there are different knobs/buttons on this one and I have not mastered what to turn to get what the station I want. Next time I will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: B Brown

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I got the headphones with the am/fm radio that runs on 2 AA batteries. They work great to cancel out the extremely loud noise of my tractor, the radio works great (I love the voice assist) and the batteries last a long time. They fit my head (which is VERY small - I have to wear child size ballcaps) and they also fit my husband's head which is very large. People may think I am crazy when they see me on the tractor "rocking out" to my favorite station. It makes sitting on the tractor now for hours not just bearable, but fun!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Heimbach

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair before. Bought a more expensive pair from another supplier. Could not hear radio over mower. The item was packaged where it was impossible to open without destroying the packaging. More money does not make it better. 3m WORK TUNES came in packaging that was easy to remove without damage to box. 3M WORK TUNES were far more comfortable, better fit, and the volume was adequate to hear over mower. If it works, don't fix it. Recommend 3M WORK TUNES and will repurchase in the future again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: BUD

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my father in-law for Father’s Day! He LOVES them and said it was probably the best gift he’s gotten. Lol! He had health issues but loves to mow so it was nice for him to have something to cancel the noise and listen to at the same time. I actually bought another pair for someone else since he liked them so much.
customer_reviews.author: star31b2

customer_reviews.title: They still have kinks to work out, avoid these headphones.
customer_reviews.text: The ear muffs themselves are comfortable. But they do feel somewhat cheaply made to be honest. The thing that ruins these is the fact that volume selector knob doesn't work right, I can get sound when I have it set to off sometimes. It's an on/off switch as well and I think it is why my batteries in these are constantly dying, they also won't shut off if you forget to turn them off after you're done using them. Really wish I would've have saw the Bluetooth version before I bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon T.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mostly for the hands free radio. My craft room is next to my main living space so I wanted something I could use while the rest of the family watched TV and I wouldn't bother them. They are completely sound canceling with the radio. Without the radio my husband has to yell and I still cannot hear what he is saying. It sounds muffled. My only complaint is I wear glasses and they press on my ear pieces making them uncomfortable for long periods of time with glasses. The quality is diffinetly worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Off The Floor Designs

customer_reviews.title: Greatly improved over old "Worktunes"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset to replace an old, similar product that wore out. What an improvement! Noise protection is perceptibly more effective. Radio sensitivity, tuning ease and sound quality are radically improved. The digital tuning with search, memory and voice annunciator are very nicely implemented. I like the base boost, too. Radio volume is plenty high, able to approach the threshold of pain of around 82db, according to the manual. My only problem is the headset is a bit tight on my fat head, causing fatigue after a while. However, I imagine that contributes to noise protection by sealing the ear pads more firmly, so can't complain too much about that.
customer_reviews.author: Mort

customer_reviews.title: Can't Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that the max volume on these is so low. When riding my zero turn lawn mower l can barely hear FM radio stations over the background mower noise. I guess this is simply another ruined product of an over reaching nanny state. I add a star because they will certainly protect your hearing. 2-stars.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Kuban

customer_reviews.title: Better made than the Stanley headphones. Like the voice technology.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replace the Stanley Sync Digital AM/FM/MP3 Radio Earmuff (RST-63012) which quit picking up the AM signal after 2 years. The 3M WorkTunes look and feel much better made than the Stanley earphones. The 3M WorkTunes are also more comfortable. At first I was skeptical about the 3M voice technology, where it speaks the station numbers... but it really works well, and I don't have to take the headphones off to select stations. Verdict... 3M WorkTunes are much better than the Stanley Sync Digital AM/FM/MP3 Radio Earmuff (RST-63012).
customer_reviews.author: Holly A. Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement for my husband who uses them when doing yard work - he really liked these - and although this set doesn't have bluetooth, it works just right for him - the am/fm radio allows him to listen to football games, etc., while doing his projects. I did also purchase a set with bluetooth connection for my son-in-law - which he will enjoy since he uses his cell phone all the time and these will allow him to do his projects while staying connected if necessary, to his phone while enjoying music or sports. Again - super fast shipping thanks to AMAZON!!!
customer_reviews.author: Geejudd

customer_reviews.title: Garbage from day one
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, this review is for the first pair I had of these. I hated them. So the wife bought me the exact same ones for Christmas. Those seem to be OK so far. As for the first pair. The radio picked up almost nothing. Turning it to off did nothing. If I didn't pull out the batteries after every use, next time they would be dead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Guy

customer_reviews.title: I am really happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this product, all I had to do is put in battery put on my head turn it on wait for voice to tell me what radio station I was on and turned it one click at a time to hear the station I wanted to hear. At home working it is great, when it is used by (non-driving person) in a vehicle reception not to good. I guess too much interference. But in and outside home works great. I wish it would come in different colors (blue or red). It does block out just about all other sounds when radio is on.
customer_reviews.author: L S10

customer_reviews.title: Drowns out the neighbor's leaf blower...
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my dad as a gift. He loves them while he is doing yard work or wants to cancel out the neighbors leaf blower, lol. The only issue he has is sometimes he finds a spot that radio doesn't work well in. He is in a rural location and still says it is rare. He gas had many different brands and models over the year though and still says this is the best set he has owned and would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very well build! I had them for around 4 years and everything still works absolutely fine. I mow with them a ton and they've held up very well. I've even ran them over with my truck and they still work! One downside is comfort. After a few hours my ears start to hurt because the speakers press up against them.
customer_reviews.author: Terianne

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lawn care work.
customer_reviews.text: These headphone are great. The radio reception is real crisp, I live in a rural area as well. The aux plug works, the sound for what you get is perfect. Not too loud or soft, no it's not beats or Bose quality but is quite sufficient. The noise deadening is just about perfect, can hear enough to be safe. Fit and comfort have not been an issue. A little tight at the glasses, however; this has proven to be a great purchase. Wish I would have gotten these years ago. Has withstood rain, not torrential but nonetheless has held up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for many years now running a lawn mowing business. They have great battery life and receive well. My only improvement would be to have the volume output to be louder. I often have to have them turned up completely and still cannot understand the spoken word on weaker stations, as should be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Construction seems like good quality
customer_reviews.text: Construction seems like good quality; the fit is nice and snug; very comfortable (nice padding); definitely noise deadening. However, the sound quality is "average"; no outstanding bass as I have been accustomed to with good headphones. FM radio picks up very well too. I plan to use them while doing yardwork this summer (mow 2 acre lawn; on tractor quite a while). We ordered two sets; one for me and another as a gift. One set that came had an intermittent "short" in one of the muffs. They were VERY easlily returned, and the replacements came before I could even ship the problem pair back. Great service.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good set of earmuffs, but starts to deteriorate after 4 years.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this set of earmuffs. It was one of the best Father's Day gifts I received. It worked great cutting out the noise while riding on my mower and listening to podcasts on my MP3 player. The only issues I had with it later after about 4 years is that the plastic on the outside started to become sticking, the earmuff lining started to come off, and I couldn't run the radio anymore because it kept thinking my batteries were low (they weren't). Sound, expect a few good years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack_and_Angel

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: It's been quite some time since I purchased this product for use while I'm on my riding lawnmower. It is really nice being able to listen to some tunes while mowing the lawn AND protecting my hearing at the same time. I didn't like, or just wasn't used to, the lower volume settings from just having earbud headphones on, but I've gotten used to it and I can still hear the music pretty good. You can listen to your favorite radio station or plug in your mp3 player or phone with Pandora or I-Heart Radio or something similar. Actually quite comfortable to wear even for several hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Mulkey

customer_reviews.title: Battery Problem / Solution(I think)
customer_reviews.text: These work well, but I encountered the same battery issue as others have mentioned, i.e., being detected as weak after about 1.5 hours having been brand new Duracell batteries at the start of usage (I checked), It is apparently a flaw in the headphone electronics with detecting weak or drained alkaline batteries. THE SOLUTION TO THE BATTERY PROBLEM: I switched to rechargeable Duracell NiMH batteries (green color) and have used the same pair of batteries for 9 hours without having to recharge them. I assume but am not certain if I have solved the problem long term. The NiMH batteries are more expensive, but in this circumstance, an acceptable solution since they are rechargeable. ...hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: ArtyEm

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair over 8 years ago. I wear them nearly everyday in the spring, summer fall mowing season. This was my 4th pair I purchased as my wife and kids often work with me and everyone wanted a pair. It took 8 years for the earpiece foam to wear out , but I bought replacement foam and repaired them. The first pair is hanging in there and still working.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Kompelien

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor work
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought these headphones to use while working (lawn care/landscaping) and uses them every day for 40-50 hours each week. This is the second pair he bought, because the first pair's ear muffs deteriorated after 3 years, and he didn't realize he could just get replacements for those. These are very durable and work well!
customer_reviews.author: David Wathe

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality headset!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use while riding a lawn mower and they work great! They fit well - nice & tight! You can’t hear the sound of the mower and the music, talk & news sound great! The reception and volume could not be better! I am extremely pleased with my purchase! They are a fantastic quality headset and you won’t be disappointed by them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps ears safe and provides good FM reception
customer_reviews.text: These make mowing much better and the time flies. My ears don't ring and my hat mostly stays on, even on top of the head phones. My only gripe is that the volume doesn't go up as far as I would like. That may be because louder music would cause hearing damage, so I understand their choice, but I would still like to hear the radio a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Pigwillow

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have to block out obnoxious noise
customer_reviews.text: Also great to have when doing boring cardio at the gym since it picks up both AM/FM and you can choose whatever kind of available music will make cardio less tedious. After some exercise, the ear pads do get a bit sweaty. Not too noticeable until you take off the headphones. I like not sticking things in my ears so prefer these to earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Alice L. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and protectdion
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset to use on my lawn tractor, but also when I work with saws and sanders outside. It does a pretty good job of overcoming noise, except I have to turn the volume up pretty high so I can hear it over the tractor. It takes a little practice to use the controls without taking it off, but it works properly when you use it as the instructions dictate. The only issue is it seems to go through the two batteries quicker than I expected. I get a "low battery" warning after about 5 hours usage, but I just replace them with another set of rechargeables.
customer_reviews.author: RedLeg

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I didn’t look for something like this sooner. I often work out in the yard all day, and this makes it MUCH more fun. They cancel out all other noise and I like that you can Preselect just a few channels so that you don’t have to go through all of them to find music you like.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy O'Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Fairly comfortable/decent product
customer_reviews.text: Like other have stated, the volume will not blow you away - but face it, you are trying to save your hearing with the sound attenuation! If you want loud then just listen to the loud noise you are trying to cover up! Battery life is pretty long, radio reception works fine for me, seal tightly to my head, stay put without sliding forward or backward. Sound quality is so-so, not high fidelity by any means.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Davis

customer_reviews.title: Everything I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Losing some of my hearing with age. I take these with me to MLB games. They cancel out all the crap in the loud speakers and leave me in bliss. They tune well, and give me sound at a civilized level so I can actually hear. I can listen to the radio while there's chaos all around me. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: TALKS TO LIONS

customer_reviews.title: Poor reception...
customer_reviews.text: I wear these when I'm riding my tractor and mowing. I don't get any am reception to speak of and can only manage to receive a few fm stations. I'm thinking I'll get a car radio for the tractor and connect it to headphones, as my car's radio gets good reception at my location, but this set gets almost no reception to speak of. I sometimes attach my phone and listen to music or podcasts from my phone, but the speakers aren't amplified in this mode and they aren't very efficient, so even with my phone on max volume I can barely hear the podcasts. They do protect my ears and are more comfortable than cheap ear protection headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sage

customer_reviews.title: These things are great and make getting through a day on a construction ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are great and make getting through a day on a construction site soooo much better. The speakers are not crazy loud, so dont expect them to replace regular headphones for enjoying music. When using loud tools and machinery they are amazing though. The batteries have lasted me a little over two weeks of heavy use every day. You will get an alert saying low battery and then they die, so keep extra batteries with you. They are also really comfortable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The 3M product is better suited to the job
customer_reviews.text: I started out mowing with firearms type ear protection because that is what I had. I was able to add music to them with a player and a cable.The 3M product is better suited to the job. Radio reception is good and sound quality is as well. I could add the volume is a bit low at max but that may not be fair as they are probably limited since it is a "safety" item. I don't think safety item company is going to make a set that will pound your ears. Still good enough to hear well while riding a mower.
customer_reviews.author: Squiggles Mc Doogle

customer_reviews.title: GET THESE!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dad who is around noise all day. he is starting have issues with hearing since he has worked in a factory for over 30 years. so i bought these for him to help when he moves the grass and weed eat and other things that are loud. He loves them and really loves the radio station. He can see him bobbing his head to the music as he does yard work! he loves them alot!
customer_reviews.author: Charity J.

customer_reviews.title: Clear reception!
customer_reviews.text: Really a bargain for the price. These are durable and the reception is really clear. Bought these for my husband. He is a landscaper who refuses to carry his phone when he is out of the truck working. He absolutely loves them! He is able to listen to music without being concerned about damaging his phone. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband LOVES them!
customer_reviews.text: When my husband's first pair wore out, after 15 years, he struggled to decided which brand to replace them with. This was as close as he could find to the originals and he likes them even better. We live in a rural area with hills, so reception was a concern. They fit his large head well, they're very comfortable and the reception is great.
customer_reviews.author: Lou E.

customer_reviews.title: Just what my husband wanted
customer_reviews.text: My husband owns a garden and grounds keeping business and wears these all the time while he is working. They are excellent for noise protection and also provides the ability to clearly hear the radio while he works. This becomes especially important when there are weather alerts that may impact his safety while he is working . These are exactly as pictured and described, were well packaged and arrived on time. When he needs new ear phones, we will definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: kittylover

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I work at a golf course operating a 2 year old John Deer rough terrain mower , it is loud but just purchased these head phones and can't hear anything but the mower with the volume turned up all the way , the reception is terrible and the station turning knob is so loose it won't stay on the station if wearing the hood of my sweat shirt ! I had a pair of DeWalt head phones that worked so much better but I dropped them one time and the bezel broke and I had to guess to find the radio station that I wanted to listen to !
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD ACHSTETTER

customer_reviews.title: Great for industrial use!
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones daily in a loud work environment and I LOVE them. After trying some Stanley brand headphones I prefer these 3m headphones. They provide a comfortable fit for long wear times even under safety glasses and a half shield respirator. The fm/am radio works great for listening to the radio while working but I prefer listening to my own music through the auxiliary provided. Using the aux cord I can enjoy my own music at high quality and the volume is great for work.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Love these Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. My son had a pair and when I tried them I had to get some for myself. They are great for listening to games while I am mowing the lawn or doing other yard work so I can still enjoy the games without feeling like I'm wasting the time. They also protect my hearing well but I can still hear someone if they are trying to get my attention. I like the way they cover both AM and FM bands and allow a portable mp3 player to be connected as well. Also, the verbal annunciation of the frequency makes them ideal so you can tell that you are receiving the station you want.
customer_reviews.author: Reader123

customer_reviews.title: Burns through batteries
customer_reviews.text: I really like these when they work! I have been using similar 3 m radio earmuffs for years and this pair seems to go through batteries like crazy. I use the same Duracell battery I always have. Not cheap ones. I will go to use them and they will be dead. I never got a warning saying low battery and always turn them off even though they will by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Worth every cent
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this product. Does a great job reducing my lawn mower noise and the radio sounds perfect. It's also easy to operate. No problems with the battery life either. I've worn these every time I have mowed since I received them. I takes 3 hours to mow my lawn and I just finished mowing for the 10th time tonight and the batteries are still good. I do use Duracell and would guess people who have complained about the battery life have been using cheap batteries.
customer_reviews.author: everyday joe

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and tight against the head.
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised. For me, they are hard to program. They certainly keep out the noise; however, the fit is so tight against my head I can only wear them a short time before I start getting a headache. I tried bending the wires to loosen the pressure, but no luck with doing that. If they had an internal antenna I could use them for hearing protection at the range, as long as I didn't stay too long. I got them for mowing the lawn, but they are hot and really tight. They are a little on the heavy side and I wouldn't buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K

customer_reviews.title: Great reception and fits my big head.
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first hearing protection / radio headphone but so far ( about 6 months ) it is light years ahead of the others. If no buttons are touched after what seems like an hour, it says it's shutting down in ten seconds which of course would save batteries if left on an unattended. If the battery is low it tells you that too. It tells you the station number you're listening too when powering up and when tuning into stations. The reception is as good as my best receiver if not better. Best of all, it's large enough to fit my head comfortably which was not the case with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome Lul

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was horrible
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully they even worked. The seller shipped these in the original box (thin store packaging), didn't put them in a cardboard shipping box. The box was mangled and damaged. Amazingly they still worked and work like normal to this day. That should say something about the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ljmarie

customer_reviews.title: Great as a hearing protector, but not as a radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for listening to the radio while I work in my yard. I found its receiver not very good at holding a station. Often it only gets decent reception in one direction and I need to turn there in order to listen. Obviously, this is not ideal while moving and working. I wish the manufacturer inserted a better AM/FM package in this this otherwise solid design
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Use these while mowing the lawn. Was concerned if I would be able to hear the music while mowing but they perform quite well. No need to crank the volume all the way up. Nice feature to tell you the station you are on. I have a 25 hp, 52" riding mower that makes a fair amount of noise. Battery life is excellent. Takes 2 hours to mow the lawn and these are quite comfortable. Only drawback is the antenna sometimes gets entangled in low branches ripping the headset off. Easy fix, trim the tree branches.
customer_reviews.author: Su

customer_reviews.title: This radio is amazing.  It is ever so well designed and built
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio July 2, 2014. I live in the Rockies and wear the radio when I go skiing. I ski a lot and once in a while I fall. The radio flies off my head and bounces off the steep hard bumps through the air only to bounce again (over and over and over) all the way down the hill. I pick myself and carefully ski down to where the radio has landed (twice in the rocks) and put it back on my head. And in the numerous falls the phone clicks right in, not only clicks; but, with a solid clicking sound.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weinstein

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This pair was purchased for my granddaughter for Christmas. I have had a pair for 2 years. They are awsome. I wear them while mowing. The batteries last for a long time. They are very comfortable and cut the noise from the mower. I highly recommend these. They are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: toollaldy

customer_reviews.title: Gift for Husband - Glad I Purchased
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item for my husband as a Christmas gift. He is using it at work to drown out noise and chatter since he sits in a cubicle - surrounded by lots of other employees. He is very pleased with the product ; headphone gets good radio reception - whether indoors or outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Debby G

customer_reviews.title: Clearly, You do not want noise.
customer_reviews.text: It does all it is supposed to do, but the nobs are too large for me and got knock out of place. Sometimes they involuntary touched some surface and changed the frequency ( I use them at work), they must be designed for winter. As any earphones they get rather hot if used the whole day, but that is normal. I find them useful in preserving my hearing and calmness while listening to audio in a noisy environment (other people's music and tools).
customer_reviews.author: Jose De-freitas

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Reduce Noise Well, Radio Not So Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically for the radio, especially while doing yard work such as mowing, string trimming--anything with a loud motor. The noise reduction is very good with these, and they are very comfortable to wear for hours. The down side is that they don't receive radio stations very well, and they do not have good volume at all. Can barely hear anything on the radio, even though set to maximum volume. A shame, as its otherwise very well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Readinger

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand the "music" at my gym LA Fitness It's horrible! These earphones mask out the uncreative sampled crap so I can hear real music! The knobs are very intuitively operational and are easily used without looking. A lot of headphones are uncomfortable but these are nice and mushy and comfy :)
customer_reviews.author: Sirena Pendragon

customer_reviews.title: Does not pick up radio stations
customer_reviews.text: We tried 2 pair, neither worked. They did not pick up any radio stations at all. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Hill Reader

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for weed whacking and lawn mowing. Great being able to listen to the radio while doing these chores. I have always worn hearing protection and feel these give the same level of protection. The radio is loud enough and it is great that it tells you what station you are on as you turn the knob.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised.  Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had a version of these for a long time. They had a window that showed the frequency that was nice, however, they always had background noise in them. They finally went bad, so I ordered a similar pair that also had a frequency window, but I could not get them to tune in the main station I wanted...a local station with a strong signal. I returned them. Then I saw these and hesitated ordering them because you couldn't see what station you had on. Ordered them anyway because it said it would announce the frequency. I have been over-joyed with these ever since I receive them. They are great, work as advertised, and have no background noise. Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: lilputt

customer_reviews.title: Ear cushions don’t last very long
customer_reviews.text: Second time purchasing this item. Good hearing protection. Good sound quality. Foam cushion on ear piece is comfortable but will crack and deteriorate within a few years with occasional use. Replacement cushions cost almost as much as a new unit.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: I tried....
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty awesome. I used them for about 1 day before I personally found a fault with them that I cannot deal with but I don't think other people will have the same problem. They block out a lot of noise. Though they don't block out enough of my mowers engine noise. I had to turn the volume up all the way. These are pretty comfortable HOWEVER - because of the packaging, the antenna kept lodging itself between my head and the band. It was uncomfortable. Also, I tried, I really tried, to wear sunglasses with theses and NO. Just no. So, these are good. They are for someone else though. They might even be more geared towards men.
customer_reviews.author: KhouriTop Contributor: Pets

product_meta.title: 3M WorkTunes AM/FM Hearing Protector with Audio Assist Technolog, 24 dB NRR
product_meta.description:
Style:3m WorktunesInfuse more fun into your workday with 3M WorkTunes Hearing Protector with AM/FM Radio. Designed to bring you hearing protection and entertainment, these protective earmuffs let you listen to the music of your choice from the AM/FM radio or from your mobile device via the auxiliary jack. Built in comfort features like plush ear cushions and a padded headband help keep you comfortable while on the job. Plus, Voice Assist Technology lets you know which radio station you're on without having to remove the headset. So whether you're cutting grass or hard at work in the woodshop, help protect your hearing–and have a great time while you're at it–with 3M WorkTunes Hearing Protector with AM/FM Radio. Noise Reduction Rating (NRR) 24dB.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
LIMITATIONS: WARNING - This hearing protection product helps reduce exposure to hazardous noise and other loud sounds. Misuse or failure to wear hearing protectors at all times that you are exposed to noise may result in hearing loss or injury. For proper use, see user instructions or call 3M Technical Service toll free at 1-800-494-3552. In Canada, call 1-800-267-4414. *CAUTION: 3M strongly recommends fit testing of hearing protectors. Research suggests that many users will receive less noise reduction than indicated by the NRR due to variation in hearing protector fit, fitting skill and motivation of the user. If the NRR is used, 3M recommends that it be reduced by 50% or in accordance with applicable regulations.
feature_bullets: Great AM/FM radio performance and bass boost option for enhanced listening experience
Audio Assist Technology provides operational and set-up guidance¬–without having to take off the headset
Audio Assist Technology helps you program up to 50 AM/FM radio stations and lets you know when your battery is running low
Auto-scanning helps you quickly find and save your favorite stations
Plug into your smartphone or other mobile device to enjoy entertainment of your choice
Easy-to-use controls can be operated even while wearing work gloves
Rugged design is great for everyday use
Makes an excellent gift for the yard or woodworking enthusiast
Automatic shut-off helps extend the life of your batteries

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars7,407 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
